data.title: Famous People Born in 1922
data.meta_description: Celebrate the birthdays of 661 famous people, historical figures and celebrities born in 1922 like Judy Garland, Stan Lee and Charles M. Schulz.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 661

Ernest "Fritz" Hollings, American Democratic Senator from South Carolina (1966-2005) and Governor of South Carolina (1959-63), born in Charleston, South Carolina (d. 2019)

Jason Evers, American actor (Wrangler, Channing), born in New York City (d. 2005)

Jan 2 Nico Schuyt, Dutch composer, born in Alkmaar, Netherlands (d. 1992)

Bill Travers [William Inge Lindon-Travers], British actor, director, officer and animal rights activist (Born Free, Gorgo), born in Sunderland, England (d. 1994)

Jan 3 Jacques Wildberger, Swiss composer (In My End Is My Beginning), born in Basel, Switzerland (d. 2006)

Jan 3 Morten Nielsen, Danish poet and resistance fighter, born in Ålborg, Denmark (d. 1944)

Frank Wess, American jazz flutist, saxophonist (Duke Ellington, 1953-64; New York Jazz Quartet, 1974-82), and composer, born in Kansas City, Missouri (d. 2013)

Admiral Sir Anthony Synnot, Chief of the Australian Defence Force, born in Corowa, Australia (d. 2001)

Finn Einar Mortensen, Norwegian composer, born in Oslo, Norway (d. 1983)

Alvin Dark, American baseball player and manager, born in Comanche, Oklahoma, (d. 2014)

Jan 7 Jean-Pierre Rampal, French classical flautist (The Suite for Flute and Jazz Piano), born in Marseilles, France (d. 2000)

Jan 7 Robert De Cormier, American conductor and musical director (The Belafonte Folk Singers), born on Long Island, New York (d. 2017)

Ahmed Sékou Touré, first President of Guinea (1958-84), born in Faranah, Guinea (d. 1984)

Jan 9 Har Gobind Khorana, Indian-American biochemist (Nobel 1968), born in Raipur, Punjab, British India (d. 2011)

Ester Mägi, Estonian composer 'First Lady of Estonian music', born in Tallinn, Estonia (d. 2021)

Ernle Bradford, English historian and writer (d. 1986)

Jan 11 Neville Duke, English WWII flying ace (shot down 27 planes ), test pilot (air speed record 1953), born in Tonbridge, Kent (d. 2007)

Tadeusz Żychiewicz, Polish journalist and art historian, born in Bratkowice, Poland (d. 1994)

(Clarence) "Bud" Anderson, US Army Air Force flying ace (WWII), US Air Force officer (Vietnam), and test pilot, born in Oakland, California (d. 2024) [1]

Jan 13 John Hewer, English actor famous for portraying Captain Birdseye in British commercials, born in London (d. 2008)

Sir Eric Willis, Australian politician, born in Murwillumbah, Australia (d. 1999)

Jan 15 Thelma Carpenter, American radio and jazz band singer (Coleman Hawkins; Count Basie), and stage and screen actress (Hello, Dolly!; Barefoot In The Park (TV); The Wiz (film)), born in Brooklyn, New York (d. 1997)

Ernesto Bonino, Italian pop singer, born in Turin, Italy (d. 2008)

Betty White

American Emmy Award-winning comic actress with the longest TV career of a female entertainer (The Mary Tyler Moore Show - "Sue Ann Nivens"; Golden Girls - "Rose"; The Proposal), born in Oak Park Illinois [1]

Luis Echeverria Alvarez, Mexican politician, President of Mexico (1970-76), born in Mexico City (d. 2022)

Jan 17 Nicholas Katzenbach, lawyer (US Attorney General), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 2012)

Jan 18 Yehezkel Braun, Israeli composer (Shir ha-shirim), born in Breslau, Germany (d. 2014)

Arthur Morris, Australian cricket batsman (46 Tests, 12 x 100, HS 206, BA 46.48; NSWCA), born in Sydney, Australia (d. 2015)

Jan 19 Guy Madison [Robert Moseley], American actor (Wild Bill Hickok), born in Pumpkin Center, California (d. 1996)

English actor (A Man for All Seasons, Train), born in Hurst, England

Jules de Palm, Antilles writer, born in Curaçao (d. 2013)

Jan 25 Raymond Baxter, English television presenter and writer (Fast Lady), born in Ilford, United Kingdom (d. 2006)

Pandit Bhimsen Joshi, Indian classical singer (khayal form of singing, bhajans, abhangs), born in Ron, Karnataka, India (d. 2011)

Feb 13 Gordon Tullock, American economist (public choice theory), born in Rockford, Illinois (d. 2014)

Murray the K [Kaufman], American disk jockey (5th Beatle), born in New York City (d. 1982)

Herman Kahn, American, writer and military strategist (Thinking About the Unthinkable), born in Bayonne, New Jersey (d. 1983)

Feb 15 John B. Anderson, American politician and 1980 Republican presidential candidate, born in Rockford, Illinois (d. 2017)

Geraint Evans, Welsh bass-baritone opera singer (Das Knaben Wunderhorn), born in Cilfynydd, Wales (d. 1992)

Enrico Banducci, American nightclub owner (d. 2007)

Kanwar Rai Singh, Indian cricket batsman (1 Test; Services, Southern Punjab), born in Darkati, India (d. 1993)
